{{unreferenced|date=October 2009}} {{Infobox_Broadcast | call_letters = DWNJ-TV | station_logo = | station_slogan = Oras-Oras. Alam ko. | station_branding = ''GMA News TV-28 Naga'' | analog = 28([[UHF]]) | digital = | founded = [[2009]] | affiliations = [[GMA News TV]] | location = [[Naga City, Camarines Sur|Naga City]] | owner = [[GMA Network, Inc.]]
ZOE Broadcasting Network, Inc. | sister_stations = [[DWAI-TV]] ([[GMA Network]]) | callsign_meaning = DW '''N'''adine '''J'''acinto | former_affiliations = [[Q (TV network)|Q Network]] (2009-2011) | effective_radiated_power = 10,000 watts | homepage = [http://www.wmn.ph/qtv] }} '''DWNJ-TV''', channel 28, is a television station of [[GMA News TV]] in Naga City, Camarines Sur. This was formerly affiliated to [[Q (TV network)|Q Network]]. Its studios and transmitters are located at GMA Broadcast Center, Naga City Subdivision, Naga City, Camarines Sur. It covers the whole Naga City and nearby towns. Establishment of Q channel 28 as a relay of Q channel 11 Manila is part of GMA Network's expansion of provincial stations and establishment of GMA Regional Network in Bicol Region. In February 28, 2011, it will reformat to '''[[GMA News TV]]'''. '''QTV 28 Naga on Cable:''' {| class="wikitable" |- ! Cable/Satellite Provider ! Ch. # ! Coverage |- | Sky Cable Naga | 19 | [[Naga City, Camarines Sur]] |- | Caceres Cable Naga | 15 | [[Camarines Sur]] |} == Affiliates == :''Further information: [[List of broadcasters owned or affiliated with GMA Network#GMA News TV|GMA News TV Stations]]'' ==See also== *[[GMA Network|GMA Network, Inc.]] *[[Campus Radio Naga]] {{Naga City TV}} {{GMA Luzon}} [[Category:Television stations in Naga City]] {{Philippines-tv-stub}} [[Category:GMA Network stations]]
